abstract.p: New York State Environmental Conservation Comr John P Cahill is named grand marshal for St Patrick's Day parade in Yonkers (S)

block.p: The grand marshal for this year's St. Patrick's Day parade in Yonkers, is John P. Cahill, the state's Environmental Conservation commissioner.

Commissioner Cahill is of Irish descent. His father, James, was a native of County Longford, Ireland, and his mother, Mary, is a native of County Cavan. The commissioner was raised in Yonkers and has served on the St. Patrick's Day Parade committees in Yonkers and New York City.
The grand marshal for this year's St. Patrick's Day parade in Yonkers, is John P. Cahill, the state's Environmental Conservation commissioner.

Commissioner Cahill is of Irish descent. His father, James, was a native of County Longford, Ireland, and his mother, Mary, is a native of County Cavan. The commissioner was raised in Yonkers and has served on the St. Patrick's Day Parade committees in Yonkers and New York City.
An avid triathlete and runner, Mr. Cahill, 41, last year completed the Lake Placid Ironman, an endurance event consisting of a 2.4-mile swim, 112-mile bike ride and a 26.2-mile run.

Mr. Cahill, who was appointed to his current position in 1996, was an officer of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick. He and his wife, Kim, serve as eucharistic ministers at Sacred Heart Church in Yonkers. Mr. Cahill was also appointed in 1995 to serve as the vice chairman of the State Emergency Financial Control Board for Yonkers.
As commissioner of the State Department of Environmental Conservation, he oversees an agency of 3,900 employees.
Last year's grand marshal for Yonkers was James E. Flynn, a Yonkers businessman.

The aides chosen for the parade this year are Yonkers residents, John Donaghy, Kyran Dunn, Theresa French, Rosalie Flynn, Anna Madden, Sister Ann Marie McMahon and James Walsh, along with Mayor William Lee Kinnally Jr. of Hastings-on-Hudson.
